utter_faq/assessor.text:
People wishing to be registered as assessors with the MQA should:
- Be found competent by an ETDPSETA accredited training provider, and
- Be a subject matter expert (either through experience minimum of 2 years and qualification/s) in a mining and minerals related field in which they wish to assess.

utter_faq/register_moderator.text:
People wishing to be registered as moderators with the MQA should:
- Be MQA registered assessors; and
- Be found competent as moderators by an ETDPSETA accredited training provider.

utter_faq/mqa_certification.text: MQA certification is a recognized accreditation in the mining industry. The MQA will issue a certificate to registered learners who have completed a learning program and have passed all unit standards for a particular qualification. For more information, you can refer to the [Overview Brochure](https://mqa.org.za/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/Overview-Brochure.pdf).

utter_faq/bursary_qualifies.text: The MQA Bursary Scheme is open to qualifying grade 12 learners or those currently writing their Grade 12 exams, and students who are studying towards a certificate, diploma, degree or BTech at a university or university of technology.

The Bursary is available to deserving South African Citizens as follows:      

Unemployed individuals: Historically Disadvantaged Individuals with a strong academic record accompanied by a need for financial assistance      

Employed individuals: HDI‚Äôs individuals who are already employed within the Mining and Minerals Sector who would like to pursue studies for a qualification relevant to the mining related fields.

utter_faq/mqa_qualification.text: Companies wishing to receive Programme Approval from MQA should: Be accredited by another Quality Assurance (QA); Have a Quality Management System; Have an assessment system, including MQA registered assessors; Have a moderation system; and Have unit standard-based learning material.

Write a letter and complete the scope extension application form which can be obtained from the MQA Offices or website.

utter_app/jobs.text: The Mining Qualifications Authority (MQA) opens its application window annually between August and September. Visit [this link](https://mqa.org.za/mqa-vacancies/) for available job applications.

utter_app/bursary_application.text: The application window for the MQA Bursary opens annually between August and September. Applicants need to download the application form from the MQA website, complete it, and email it along with the required supporting documents to the designated email address. Successful candidates will receive notification of the outcome of their application by the end of November, enabling them to register for the subsequent year.

utter_faq/career_internships.text:
CRITERIA FOR THE LEARNERS TO BE PLACED BY HOST EMPLOYERS ON THE INTERNSHIP PROGRAMME
The MQA will only fund learners who meet the following criteria:
- The learner is unemployed and a South African citizen
- The graduates should have achieved the relevant qualification at a HET level (including TVET colleges, only N6 Diploma graduates are accepted into the programme)
- Must not have benefitted from an internship programmes before whether MQA funded or company funded

utter_faq/career_learnership.text: Employees of mining companies and unemployed learners who need to be placed with mining companies for on-the-job training. Note: Unemployed learners must approach mining companies to access training in learnerships, as the MQA only facilitates and funds training for mining and minerals sector employers.

utter_faq/certifications.text: If a person wishes to be accredited with the MQA should fulfill the following requirements: Produce evidence that they are in the process of implementing or have achieved the ISO 9001:2008 standard; Have an assessment system, including MQA registered assessors; Have a moderation system; and Have unit standard based learning material.

utter_faq/mentorship.text: The MQA supports transformation of the mining and minerals sector through skills development. Training interventions such as the Workplace Mentor and Coaches Programme (WMCP) funded by MQA are aimed at placing mentors and coaches within workplaces to support employers and learners with on the job mentoring and coaching activities
